column1: Kata Robata////Good location (next to dessert gallery) and really good ambience. Good display of art and use of lighting. Food is just okay for the price. I really wish they had a selection of bento boxes but they didn't. The one they had was a whopping 27 bucks. I had the houston roll
column3: and vegetable tempura. All three were okay with the eel coming out on top. Houston roll was bland
column5: and the tempura was just a small fistful for 8 bucks. But it was neatly battered and fried to a good crisp and wasn't soggy. For a large group
